**The Singing Sword** is an [intelligent](/wiki/Intelligent_artifact "Intelligent artifact") [artifact](/wiki/Artifact "Artifact") weapon in [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") and [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack"). Its default base item is a [long sword](/wiki/Long_sword "Long sword"), but it can also be named as a [rapier](/wiki/Rapier "Rapier") or a [saber](/wiki/Saber "Saber") (see below). It does not favor any role, unless the player is a [Bard](/wiki/Bard "Bard"), in which case it is Bard-favoring.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)
- [2 As a weapon](#As_a_weapon)
- [3 As an impediment to stealth](#As_an_impediment_to_stealth)
- [4 As a support item](#As_a_support_item)

## Generation

The Singing Sword cannot be randomly generated, but it can be wished for.

The Singing Sword can be named: naming any long sword, rapier, or saber The Singing Sword will transform it into the artifact. It can only be named by a Bard, an [elf](/wiki/Elf_\(starting_race\) "Elf (starting race)"), or anyone who has ever bound [Orthos](/wiki/Spirits_\(dNetHack\)#Orthos.2C_Sovereign_of_the_Howling_Dark "Spirits (dNetHack)"). Unlike in vanilla, naming artifacts does not break [illiterate](/wiki/Illiterate "Illiterate") [conduct](/wiki/Conduct "Conduct").

## As a weapon

The Sword using the [Musicalize spell](/wiki/Musicalize_spell "Musicalize spell") skill to determine bonus to-hit and damage, and also exercises that skill. Since Bards in dNetHack are very limited in terms of melee damage skills, this makes the Sword a very useful melee weapon in the early to mid game. Using it also doesn't require making a trade-off between the Bard's combat skills and their music skill.

## As an impediment to stealth

The Sword sings constantly while wielded, giving every monster on the current dungeon level your exact position. This does not wake up sleeping monsters. The Sword can be silenced by unwielding it.

## As a support item

The Sword automatically learns songs while wielded. Songs may be learned from the player's actions or from the actions of nearby monsters. The Sword can be instructed to sing a known song via #invoke, which provides a menu of valid choices and can be done as often as desired. The songs and their effects are as follows:

| A marching song        | - Pets gain +2 movement points per turn                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     | * Play the "Charge" song

* Play a charged [Magic flute](/wiki/Magic_flute "Magic flute")

| A fiery song           | - The sword deals double damage to foes that do not resist fire damage, **unless they are deaf or mindless**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                | * Play a charged [Fire horn](/wiki/Fire_horn "Fire horn")
* Hear [Oona](/wiki/Oona "Oona") sing the lament of flames                                                     |
| A chilling song        | - The sword deals double damage to foes that do not resist cold damage, **unless they are deaf or mindless**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                | * Play a charged [Frost horn](/wiki/Frost_horn "Frost horn")
* Hear [Oona](/wiki/Oona "Oona") sing the lament of ice                                                     |

Song Effect Learned by
Nothing in particular
  • No effect (beyond giving away your location)
  • Default song
Chant ominously
  • Enemies are very likely to flee after being struck by the sword in melee, unless they are deaf or mindless
  • Play the "Fear" song

Confuse my foes
  • Enemies become confused after being struck by the sword in melee, unless they are deaf or mindless
  • Play the "Cacophony" song
Disrupt spellcasting
  • Enemies struck by the sword in melee have their special abilities put on cooldown, unless they are deaf or mindless
  • Play the "Disruption" song

  • Play the "Inspire Courage" song
  • Hear a monster sing a song of courage

  • Enemies lose 1 + the swords enchantment to to to-hit and damage vs. all targets
  • Hear Oona sing a dirge

  • The sword deals double damage to foes that do not resist fire damage, unless they are deaf or mindless
  • Play a charged Fire horn
  • Hear Oona sing the lament of flames

  • The sword deals double damage to foes that do not resist cold damage, unless they are deaf or mindless
  • Play a charged Frost horn
  • Hear Oona sing the lament of ice
An electrifying song
  • The sword deals double damage to foes that do not resist electric damage, unless they are deaf or mindless
  • Hear Oona sing the lament of storms
An earthshaking chant
  • The sword periodically (10% chance) causes an earthquake whenever it hits a foe in melee
  • Play a charged Drum of earthquake
  • Hear a Dread seraph sing its earthquake song
A tune of opening
  • The sword periodically (5% chance) slices targets open, killing them or dealing heavy damage
  • This effect also reveals all secret doors and traps around the character whenever it triggers
  • Ring the charged Bell of Opening
Of the passing of life
  • The sword periodically (25% chance) kills targets that do not resist death magic, unless they are deaf or mindless
  • Hear a Dread seraph sing its killing song
Beat to the Cadence
  • Pets which may leave corpses *always* leave corpses, and rise from the grave after a few turns if their corpse is not destroyed
  • All pets are immune to digestion attacks
  • You gain 1 + the swords enchantment to to-hit and damage (this stacks with any standard enchantment bonus on wielded weapons)
  • Hear a Dread seraph sing its resurrection song
A hymn to the creator
  • Enemies go insane after being struck by the sword in melee, unless they are deaf or mindless
  • Hear a Dread seraph sing its madness song
